title: What should I say at the end of my speech? - Quora

response.answer_text: End your presentation with a short story explaining how it affects others in the best way.End with interesting facts that can engage the audience because facts with statistical numbers in them work well.Acknowledge people or companies for providing valuable data or information, research paper, etcPresent a visual image that clearly conveys your message with a purpose to impact the audience in such a way that they think about it for the next few minutes.Instead of thank you slide use summary slide and say thank you verballyClosing a presentation with a look back at the opening message is a great way to round off your messageEnd up with a call to action which should be clear and specificA good PPT design is as important as delivering it. To create a highly effective and creative PPT you can download PowerPoint templates from here. They are easy to customize and also compatible with Google Slides. Annual Business Plan PowerPoint Presentation Slides  Advertising Media Planning And Strategy PowerPoint Presentation Slides

At the end of your speech you summarize the main points you covered in the body of he speech. You turn to whoever introduced you, gesture at that person, say, “Mr. Chairman (or whatever the title is)” Wait for that person to return to the lectern or speakers stand. Shake that persons hand, and leave. DO NOT thank the audience.
